column4: I'm trying to better understand Solaris10.  It's not Linux, but it seems to run KDE, GNome, and all sorts of other linux apps.  I guess, what I'm asking is - what makes it different?
solaris is a unix, it has a different kernel, basically
a lot of the software for *nix runs on any "posix compliant" system, so linux and unix can share a lot of software.
try gnumeric for you .xls files maybe
